DOC.brief_summary: The central aim of this application is to determine whether improved outcomes with tight euglycemic control are due to insulin-specific responses. The investigators hypothesize that improving insulin resistance will lead to decreased inflammatory and hypermetabolic responses, as well as restored glucose metabolism, and so result in improved clinical outcome of severely burned patients.
DOC.brief_title: Glucose Control in Severely Burned Patients
DOC.criteria: between 18 and 90 years of age >20% TBSA Admitted to the burn unit within 120 hours following burn At least 1 surgical intervention necessary death upon admission decision not to treat due to burn injury severity presence of anoxic brain injury that is not expected to result in complete recovery known history of AIDS, ARC, HIV, Hepatitis BE history of cancer within 5 years of malignancy currently under treatment inability to obtain informed consent previous or existing renal dysfunction, liver disease, or hepatic dysfunction preexisting type I diabetes mellitus pregnancy allergy to metformin
